【考法 1】 v. 抱怨： to express dissatisfaction, pain, or resentment usually tiresomely
【例】 All workers were griping about the new regulations. 所有的工人都在抱怨新规章。
【近】 carp, fuss, grouch, grouse, grumble, wail
【反】 crow, delight, rejoice 欢快，喜悦
【考法 2】 v. 激怒： to disturb the peace of mind of (someone) especially by repeated disagreeable acts
【例】 constant complaints from the customers griped her to the point where she started snapping back 顾客持续的抱怨让她也到了爆点
【近】 aggravate, annoy, bother, chafe, exasperate, nettle, peeve, pique, rile, ruffle, vex
【记】 源自grasp；抓人的，挠人心的，令人烦燥的，现在人们都紧抓着手里的东西不放，还发牢骚抱怨没抓到的东西；音：给，割 + ripe 熟，去吃烤肉，给割点熟的(肉)，别老给半生不熟的
